questions.question: How can doctors make sure the astronauts’ bodies work well enough to exercise in space?

choices.answer: Make sure the astronaut gets enough sleep
Make sure the astronaut's stomach gets the molecules from food and air
Make sure the astronaut's cells get the molecules from food and air
Make sure his cells get different types of molecules from food and air

questions.question: If a person ate some syrup made of pure glucose, what would happen to her ability to exercise?

choices.answer: It would be harder for her to exercise.
It would be easier for her to exercise.
Nothing, but her respiratory system would not work as hard.
Nothing, but her digestive system would not work as hard.

questions.question: Normal levels of oxygen and glucose molecules but no starch molecules. Will this patient be able to exercise normally?

choices.answer: Yes, the glucose and oxygen molecules can react together to release energy
No, his digestive system is not breaking down food molecules
No, his body systems are working, but he needs to eat different food
Yes, as long as his cells have glucose they will release energy.

questions.question: Why would it be harder to exercise when you have a digestion problem?

choices.answer: You would not be able to sleep, which would make you too tired.
Your cells would have molecules from air, but not from food.
You would need to breathe in a lot more air molecules.
You would not get any of the molecules your cells need to exercise.

questions.question: The human body only works properly when cells are getting molecules from food and molecules from air.

choices.answer: True
False

questions.question: Zariah’s respiratory system is not working well. Why is this a problem for her ability to exercise?

choices.answer: She will not be able to break down molecules from air into oxygen.
Her cells will not work well when they have low levels of oxygen.
Her digestive system will have to work twice as hard.
The molecules from air will be too large for her body to use.

questions.question: Asthma is a condition in which it can be very hard for a person to breathe in enough air. Would exercise be difficult?

choices.answer: No, as long as the person is getting enough sleep.
No, as long as the person's cells are getting different types of molecules.
No, the person can still exercise normally.
Yes, it will be difficult for a person with asthma to exercise.

questions.question: Perla is eating healthy foods, but her respiratory system is not working well. Can she exercise normally?

choices.answer: Yes, her body gets everything it needs for energy from molecules in food.
No, her respiratory system does not have enough oxygen.
No, her cells do not have enough oxygen to react with glucose.
No, her cells do not have enough oxygen to react with proteins.
